title: Jethro Tull - A Passion Play 5.0 DTS Universal DVD-A-V
description:
Jethro Tull
A Passion Play

Original AreA51 text:

5.0 Universal DVD-A
24-96 MLP, 24-48 DTS, 24-48 Dolby Digital
Stereo to surround conversion by Area51
Slipcover artwork included

Tracklist:
One long song divided into 14 parts (mainly so you can skip Hare if you want to!) [btw - I love &#039;Hare&#039;]

To play the MLP you need a DVD-A capable player. To play the DTS you
need a DTS decoder somewhere in your system. The DD will play on
any DVD player. PowerDVD will play all of the streams on your pc.

DVD-Audio side contains 24/96 MLP 5.0 Surround Sound,
upmixed from stereo using the SHIT process.

DVD-Video side contains 5.0 DTS and 5.0 DD as well as
all five isolated channels, plus lyric subtitles.

Option of cycling through all seven audio streams as the
album is playing using the language button. Streams cycle
in this order: 5.0 DD, 5.0 DTS, C, FL, FR, SL, SR. Or access
the iso streams directly through the video menu. I never
appreciated the brilliance of this performance until I listened
to the indivudual isolated channels, particularly Martin Barre&#039;s
stunning guitar work.

Subtitle button will enable or disable lyrics display. No there&#039;s no
karaoke track! Although you could probably sing along with one of
the rear channel isos if you so desire. 

--------------------------------------------------

This is a reseed from the good old D-E_M_O_N_O_I_D tracker
